00048 CDRGNURBSSurface::CDRGNURBSSurface()
00049 {
00050 
00051         m_pControlPoints = NULL;
00052         m_UKnots = NULL;
00053         m_VKnots = NULL;
00054         m_UBasisCoefficients = NULL;
00055         m_VBasisCoefficients = NULL;
00056         m_UBasis = NULL;
00057         m_dUBasis = NULL;
00058         m_VBasis = NULL;
00059         m_dVBasis = NULL;
00060         m_UTemp = NULL;
00061         m_dUTemp = NULL;
00062         m_TessUKnotSpan = NULL;
00063         m_TessVKnotSpan = NULL;
00064 
00065         m_iUTessellations = 0;
00066         m_iVTessellations = 0;
00067 
00068         m_pVertices = NULL;
00069 }

00071 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00072 //
00073 // Free up anything we've allocated
00074 //
00075 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00076 void CDRGNURBSSurface::Cleanup(void)
00077 {
00078         ALIGNED_DELETE(m_pControlPoints);
00079         ALIGNED_DELETE(m_UKnots);
00080         ALIGNED_DELETE(m_VKnots);
00081         ALIGNED_DELETE(m_UBasisCoefficients);
00082         ALIGNED_DELETE(m_VBasisCoefficients);
00083         ALIGNED_DELETE(m_UBasis);
00084         ALIGNED_DELETE(m_dUBasis);
00085         ALIGNED_DELETE(m_VBasis);
00086         ALIGNED_DELETE(m_dVBasis);
00087         ALIGNED_DELETE(m_UTemp);
00088         ALIGNED_DELETE(m_dUTemp);
00089         ALIGNED_DELETE(m_pVertices);
00090         SAFE_DELETE(m_TessUKnotSpan);
00091         SAFE_DELETE(m_TessVKnotSpan);
00092 }
00093 
00094 CDRGNURBSSurface::~CDRGNURBSSurface()
00095 {
00096         Cleanup();      // Free everything :-)
00097 }

00099 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00100 //
00101 // Initialize a CDRGNURBSSurface object.  This will normally only be called
00102 // once for a particular object but it's safe to call it more than once.
00103 //
00104 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00105 bool CDRGNURBSSurface::Init(int uDegree,
00106                                                                 int     vDegree,
00107                                                                 int uControlPoints,
00108                                                                 int vControlPoints,
00109                                                                 Point4D *pControlPoints,
00110                                                                 float *pUKnots,
00111                                                                 float *pVKnots,
00112                                                                 int iDefaultUTessellations,
00113                                                                 int iDefaultVTessellations
00114                                                         )
00115 {
00116         // In case we've already been initialized.
00117         Cleanup();
00118 
00119         // Copy the stuff we're given
00120         //
00121         m_iUDegree = uDegree;
00122         m_iVDegree = vDegree;
00123         m_iUControlPoints = uControlPoints;
00124         m_iVControlPoints = vControlPoints;
00125 
00126         //
00127         // Compute some other useful quantities
00128         //
00129         m_iUOrder = m_iUDegree + 1;
00130         m_iVOrder = m_iVDegree + 1;
00131         m_iUKnots = m_iUOrder + m_iUControlPoints;
00132         m_iVKnots = m_iVOrder + m_iVControlPoints;
00133 
00134         // Calculate how many valid spans exist in the Knot vectors
00135         m_iUBasisSpans = m_iUKnots - 2 * m_iUDegree;
00136         m_iVBasisSpans = m_iVKnots - 2 * m_iVDegree;
00137 
00138 
00139         //
00140         // Allocate some memory for the control points, knots, and basis stuff
00141         //
00142         m_pControlPoints = ALIGNED_NEW(m_iUControlPoints * m_iVControlPoints, Point4D);
00143         m_UKnots = ALIGNED_NEW(m_iUKnots, float);
00144         m_VKnots = ALIGNED_NEW(m_iVKnots, float);
00145 
00146         // For each span in the knot vector, there will be m_iUOrder (and m_iVOrder)
00147         // Basis polynomials that are non-zero.  Each of those polynomials will
00148         // have m_iUOrder coefficients, hence m_iUBasisSpans * m_iUOrder * m_iUOrder
00149         m_UBasisCoefficients = ALIGNED_NEW(m_iUOrder * m_iUOrder * m_iUBasisSpans, float);
00150         m_VBasisCoefficients = ALIGNED_NEW(m_iVOrder * m_iVOrder * m_iVBasisSpans, float);
00151         m_UTemp = ALIGNED_NEW(m_iVOrder, Point4D);
00152         m_dUTemp = ALIGNED_NEW(m_iVOrder, Point4D);
00153 
00154         //
00155         // Copy the incoming data to the internal structures.  If the incoming control
00156         // points are NOT stored as pre-weighted points, then you'll need to loop over
00157         // the points and multiply x, y, and z by the w value (so that the actual,
00158         // stored control point is {x*w, y*w, z*w, w})
00159         //
00160     memcpy(m_pControlPoints, pControlPoints, m_iUControlPoints * m_iVControlPoints * sizeof(Point4D));
00161         memcpy(m_UKnots, pUKnots, m_iUKnots * sizeof(float));
00162         memcpy(m_VKnots, pVKnots, m_iVKnots * sizeof(float));
00163 
00164         ComputeBasisCoefficients();
00165 
00166         SetTessellations(iDefaultUTessellations, iDefaultVTessellations);
00167 
00168         return true;
00169 }
00170 
00171 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00172 //
00173 // Change the number of tessellations used to render the object
00174 //
00175 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00176 void CDRGNURBSSurface::SetTessellations(int iUTessellations, int iVTessellations)
00177 {
00178         if((iUTessellations != m_iUTessellations) ||
00179                 (iVTessellations != m_iVTessellations))
00180         {
00181                 m_iUTessellations = iUTessellations;
00182                 m_iVTessellations = iVTessellations;
00183 
00184                 //
00185                 // Free anything we've already allocated
00186                 //
00187                 ALIGNED_DELETE(m_UBasis);
00188                 ALIGNED_DELETE(m_VBasis);
00189                 ALIGNED_DELETE(m_dUBasis);
00190                 ALIGNED_DELETE(m_dVBasis);
00191                 SAFE_DELETE(m_TessUKnotSpan);
00192                 SAFE_DELETE(m_TessVKnotSpan);
00193 
00194                 //
00195                 // Allocate memory for the basis functions, etc
00196                 //
00197                 m_UBasis = ALIGNED_NEW(m_iUOrder * SIMD_SIZE * (m_iUTessellations+1), float);
00198                 m_VBasis = ALIGNED_NEW(m_iVOrder * SIMD_SIZE * (m_iVTessellations+1), float);
00199                 m_dUBasis = ALIGNED_NEW(m_iUOrder * SIMD_SIZE * (m_iUTessellations+1), float);
00200                 m_dVBasis = ALIGNED_NEW(m_iVOrder * SIMD_SIZE * (m_iVTessellations+1), float);
00201 
00202                 m_TessUKnotSpan = new int[ m_iUTessellations+1 ];
00203                 m_TessVKnotSpan = new int[ m_iVTessellations+1 ];
00204 
00205                 ALIGNED_DELETE(m_pVertices);
00206                 
00207                 int iVertices = ((iUTessellations+1) * (iVTessellations+1)); //2 * (iVTessellations + 1);
00208                 m_pVertices = ALIGNED_NEW(iVertices, splinePoint);
00209 
00210                 //
00211                 // Re-evaluate the basis functions
00212                 //
00213                 EvaluateBasisFunctions();
00214         }
00215 }
00216 
00217 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00218 // float CDRGNURBSSurface::ComputeCoefficient(float *fKnots, int iInterval, int i, int p, int k)
00219 //
00220 //
00221 // Determines the polynomial coefficients from the knot vector
00222 //
00223 // Remember that the b-spline basis functions of degree p on knot interval
00224 // i = (Bi,p) defined on a knot vector u = {U0, U1, ..., Um} are defined:
00225 //
00226 // Bi,0(u) = 1 if Ui <= u < Ui+1
00227 //                       0 otherwise
00228 //
00229 //             u - Ui               Ui+p+1 - u
00230 // Bi,p(u) = ---------- * Bi,p-1(u) + ------------- * Bi+1,p-1(u)
00231 //            Ui+p - Ui            Ui+p+1 - Ui+1
00232 //
00233 // 
00234 // For some degree p on interval i, there exist p+1 polynomials of 
00235 // degree p of the form:
00236 //
00237 //  Ci,p,0 + Ci,p,1 * u^1 + Ci,p,2 * u^2 + ... + Ci,p,p * u^p
00238 //
00239 // I derived a recursive formula for these constant coefficients as
00240 //
00241 //   Ci,0,0 = Bi,0(u)   (i.e. Ci,0,0 will be either 0 or 1)
00242 //
00243 // For p > 0
00244 //              Ui+p+1 * Ci+1,p-1,0       UiCi,p-1,0
00245 //    Ci,p,0 = ---------------------  -  ------------  
00246 //                Ui+p+1 - Ui+1           Ui+p - Ui
00247 //
00248 //              Ci,p-1,p-1       Ci+1,p-1,p-1
00249 //    Ci,p,p = ------------  -  ---------------  
00250 //               Ui+p - Ui       Ui+p+1 - Ui+1
00251 //
00252 // For 0<k<p
00253 //              Ci,p-1,k-1 - Ui * Ci,p-1,k       Ci+1,p-1,k-1 - Ui+p+1 * Ci+1,p-1,k
00254 //    Ci,p,k = ----------------------------  -  ------------------------------------
00255 //                      Ui+p - Ui                           Ui+p+1 - Ui+1
00256 //    
00257 //
00258 // From this, for a pth degree b-spline, for each interval i, there are 
00259 // p+1 b-spline basis functions that are non-zero and each one has p+1
00260 // coefficients.  Note that Ci,p,k is dependent on u only for determining the
00261 // knot span, i, that we're computing the coefficients for.
00262 // The next two functions compute those coefficients for the various intervals
00263 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00264 float CDRGNURBSSurface::ComputeCoefficient(float *fKnots, int iInterval, int i, int p, int k)
00265 {
00266     float fResult = 0.0f;
00267 
00268     if(p == 0)
00269     {
00270         if(i == iInterval)
00271             fResult = 1.0f;
00272     }
00273     else if(k == 0)
00274     {
00275         if(fKnots[i+p] != fKnots[i])
00276             fResult -= fKnots[i] * ComputeCoefficient(fKnots, iInterval, i, p-1, 0) / (fKnots[i+p] - fKnots[i]);
00277         if(fKnots[i+p+1] != fKnots[i+1])
00278             fResult += fKnots[i+p+1] * ComputeCoefficient(fKnots, iInterval, i+1, p-1, 0) / (fKnots[i+p+1] - fKnots[i+1]);
00279     }
00280     else if(k == p)
00281     {
00282         if(fKnots[i+p] != fKnots[i])
00283             fResult += ComputeCoefficient(fKnots, iInterval, i, p-1, p-1) / (fKnots[i+p] - fKnots[i]);
00284         if(fKnots[i+p+1] != fKnots[i+1])
00285             fResult -= ComputeCoefficient(fKnots, iInterval, i+1, p-1, p-1) / (fKnots[i+p+1] - fKnots[i+1]);
00286     }
00287     else if(k > p)
00288     {
00289         fResult = 0.0f;
00290     }
00291     else
00292     {
00293                 float C1, C2;
00294         if(fKnots[i+p] != fKnots[i])
00295         {
00296             C1 = ComputeCoefficient(fKnots, iInterval, i, p-1, k-1);
00297             C2 = ComputeCoefficient(fKnots, iInterval, i, p-1, k);
00298             fResult += (C1 - fKnots[i] * C2) / (fKnots[i+p] - fKnots[i]);
00299         }
00300         if(fKnots[i+p+1] != fKnots[i+1])
00301         {
00302             C1 = ComputeCoefficient(fKnots, iInterval, i+1, p-1, k-1);
00303             C2 = ComputeCoefficient(fKnots, iInterval, i+1, p-1, k);
00304             fResult -= (C1 - fKnots[i+p+1] * C2) / (fKnots[i+p+1] - fKnots[i+1]);
00305         }
00306 
00307     }
00308 
00309     return fResult;
00310 }
00311 
00312 
00313 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00314 // void CDRGNURBSSurface::ComputeBasisCoefficients(void)
00315 //
00316 // See the comment from the function above, ComputeCoefficient()
00317 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00318 void CDRGNURBSSurface::ComputeBasisCoefficients(void)
00319 {
00320         int i, j, k;
00321 
00322         //
00323         // Start with U.  For each Basis span calculate coefficients
00324         // for m_iUOrder polynomials each having m_iUOrder coefficients
00325         //
00326 
00327         for(i=0; i<m_iUBasisSpans; i++)
00328         {
00329                 for(j=0; j<m_iUOrder; j++)
00330                 {
00331                         for(k=0; k<m_iUOrder; k++)
00332                         {
00333                                 m_UBasisCoefficients[ (i * m_iUOrder + j) * m_iUOrder + k ] =
00334                                         ComputeCoefficient(m_UKnots, i + m_iUDegree, i + j, m_iUDegree, k);
00335                         }
00336                 }
00337         }
00338 
00339         for(i=0; i<m_iVBasisSpans; i++)
00340         {
00341                 for(j=0; j<m_iVOrder; j++)
00342                 {
00343                         for(k=0; k<m_iVOrder; k++)
00344                         {
00345                                 m_VBasisCoefficients[ (i * m_iVOrder + j) * m_iVOrder + k ] =
00346                                         ComputeCoefficient(m_VKnots, i + m_iVDegree, i + j, m_iVDegree, k);
00347                         }
00348                 }
00349         }
00350 
00351 }
00352 
00353 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00354 // void CDRGNURBSSurface::EvaluateBasisFunctions(void)
00355 //
00356 // Evaluate the polynomials for the basis functions and store the results.
00357 // First derivatives are calculated as well.
00358 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00359 void CDRGNURBSSurface::EvaluateBasisFunctions(void)
00360 {
00361         int i, j, k, idx;
00362         float u, uinc;
00363         float v, vinc;
00364 
00365         //
00366         // First evaluate the U basis functions and derivitives at uniformly spaced u values
00367         //
00368         idx = 0;
00369         u = m_UKnots[idx+m_iUDegree];
00370         uinc = (m_UKnots[m_iUKnots-m_iUOrder] - m_UKnots[m_iUDegree])/(m_iUTessellations);
00371 
00372         for(i=0; i<=m_iUTessellations; i++)
00373         {
00374                 while((idx < m_iUKnots - m_iUDegree*2 - 2) && (u >= m_UKnots[idx+m_iUDegree+1]))
00375                         idx++;
00376 
00377                 m_TessUKnotSpan[i] = idx+m_iUDegree;
00378 
00379                 //
00380                 // Evaluate using Horner's method 
00381                 //
00382                 for(j=0; j<m_iUOrder; j++)
00383                 {
00384                         m_UBasis[(i*m_iUOrder+j) * SIMD_SIZE] = m_UBasisCoefficients[ (idx * m_iUOrder + j) * m_iUOrder + m_iUDegree ];
00385                         m_dUBasis[(i*m_iUOrder+j) * SIMD_SIZE] = m_UBasis[(i*m_iUOrder+j) * SIMD_SIZE] * m_iUDegree;
00386                         for(k=m_iUDegree-1; k>=0; k--)
00387                         {
00388                                 m_UBasis[(i*m_iUOrder+j)*SIMD_SIZE] = m_UBasis[ (i*m_iUOrder+j)*SIMD_SIZE ] * u + 
00389                                         m_UBasisCoefficients[ (idx * m_iUOrder + j) * m_iUOrder + k ];
00390                                 if(k>0)
00391                                 {
00392                                         m_dUBasis[(i*m_iUOrder+j)*SIMD_SIZE] = m_dUBasis[(i * m_iUOrder+j)*SIMD_SIZE] * u + 
00393                                                 m_UBasisCoefficients[ (idx * m_iUOrder + j) * m_iUOrder + k ] * k;
00394                                 }
00395                         }
00396                         //
00397                         // Make three copies.  This isn't necessary if we're using straight C 
00398                         // code but for the Pentium III optimizations, it is.
00399                         // 
00400                 }
00401 
00402                 u += uinc;
00403         }
00404 
00405         //
00406         // Finally evaluate the V basis functions at uniformly spaced v values
00407         //
00408         idx = 0;
00409         v = m_VKnots[idx+m_iVDegree];
00410         vinc = (m_VKnots[m_iVKnots-m_iVOrder] - m_VKnots[m_iVDegree])/(m_iVTessellations);
00411 
00412         for(i=0; i<=m_iVTessellations; i++)
00413         {
00414                 while((idx < m_iVKnots - m_iVDegree*2 - 2) && (v >= m_VKnots[idx+m_iVDegree+1]))
00415                         idx++;
00416 
00417                 m_TessVKnotSpan[i] = idx+m_iVDegree;
00418 
00419                 //
00420                 // Evaluate using Horner's method 
00421                 //
00422                 for(j=0; j<m_iVOrder; j++)
00423                 {
00424                         m_VBasis[(i*m_iVOrder+j)*SIMD_SIZE] = m_VBasisCoefficients[ (idx * m_iVOrder + j) * m_iVOrder + m_iVDegree ];
00425                         m_dVBasis[(i*m_iVOrder+j)*SIMD_SIZE] = m_VBasis[(i*m_iVOrder+j)*SIMD_SIZE] * m_iVDegree;
00426                         for(k=m_iVDegree-1; k>=0; k--)
00427                         {
00428                                 m_VBasis[(i*m_iVOrder+j)*SIMD_SIZE] = m_VBasis[ (i*m_iVOrder+j)*SIMD_SIZE ] * v + 
00429                                         m_VBasisCoefficients[ (idx * m_iVOrder + j) * m_iVOrder + k ];
00430                                 if(k>0)
00431                                 {
00432                                         m_dVBasis[(i*m_iVOrder+j)*SIMD_SIZE] = m_dVBasis[(i * m_iVOrder+j)*SIMD_SIZE] * v + 
00433                                                 m_VBasisCoefficients[ (idx * m_iVOrder + j) * m_iVOrder + k ] * k;
00434                                 }
00435                         }
00436                 }
00437                 v += vinc;
00438         }
00439 }
00440 
00441 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00442 //
00443 // Tessellate the surface into triangles and submit them as a triangle
00444 // strip to Direct3D. 
00445 //
00446 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00447 void CDRGNURBSSurface::TessellateSurface()
00448 {
00449         int u, v;
00450         int k, l;
00451         int uKnot, vKnot;
00452         Point4D *UTemp = m_UTemp, *dUTemp = m_dUTemp;
00453         Point4D Pw;
00454         float rhw;
00455         int iVertices;
00456         Point4D *pControlPoints = m_pControlPoints;
00457         int iCPOffset;
00458         float VBasis, dVBasis;
00459         int idx, uidx;
00460 
00461         if((m_iUTessellations == 0) || (m_iVTessellations == 0))
00462                 return;
00463 
00464         iVertices = 2 * (m_iVTessellations + 1);
00465 
00466         // Step over the U and V coordinates and generate triangle strips to render
00467         //
00468         for(u=0; u<=m_iUTessellations; u++)
00469         {
00470                 // What's the current knot span in the U direction?
00471                 uKnot = m_TessUKnotSpan[u];
00472 
00473                 // Calculate the offset into the pre-calculated basis functions array
00474                 uidx = u * m_iUOrder * SIMD_SIZE;
00475                 vKnot = -1;
00476 
00477                 // Create one row of vertices
00478                 for(v=0; v<=m_iVTessellations; v++)
00479                 {
00480                         idx = u * m_iUTessellations + v;
00481                         if(vKnot != m_TessVKnotSpan[v])
00482                         {
00483                                 vKnot = m_TessVKnotSpan[v];
00484                                 //
00485                                 // If our knot span in the V direction has changed, then calculate some
00486                                 // temporary variables.  These are the sum of the U-basis functions times
00487                                 // the control points (times the weights because the control points have
00488                                 // the weights factored in).
00489                                 //
00490                                 for(k=0; k<=m_iVDegree; k++)
00491                                 {
00492                                         iCPOffset = (uKnot - m_iUDegree) * m_iVControlPoints + (vKnot - m_iVDegree);
00493                                         UTemp[k].x = m_UBasis[uidx] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k ].x;
00494                                         UTemp[k].y = m_UBasis[uidx] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k ].y;
00495                                         UTemp[k].z = m_UBasis[uidx] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k ].z;
00496                                         UTemp[k].w = m_UBasis[uidx] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k ].w;
00497                                         dUTemp[k].x = m_dUBasis[uidx] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k ].x;
00498                                         dUTemp[k].y = m_dUBasis[uidx] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k ].y;
00499                                         dUTemp[k].z = m_dUBasis[uidx] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k ].z;
00500                                         dUTemp[k].w = m_dUBasis[uidx] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k ].w;
00501 
00502                                         for(l=1; l<=m_iUDegree; l++)
00503                                         {
00504                                                 iCPOffset += m_iVControlPoints;
00505                                                 UTemp[k].x += m_UBasis[uidx+l * SIMD_SIZE] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k].x;
00506                                                 UTemp[k].y += m_UBasis[uidx+l * SIMD_SIZE] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k].y;
00507                                                 UTemp[k].z += m_UBasis[uidx+l * SIMD_SIZE] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k].z;
00508                                                 UTemp[k].w += m_UBasis[uidx+l * SIMD_SIZE] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k].w;
00509                                                 dUTemp[k].x += m_dUBasis[uidx+l * SIMD_SIZE] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k ].x;
00510                                                 dUTemp[k].y += m_dUBasis[uidx+l * SIMD_SIZE] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k ].y;
00511                                                 dUTemp[k].z += m_dUBasis[uidx+l * SIMD_SIZE] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k ].z;
00512                                                 dUTemp[k].w += m_dUBasis[uidx+l * SIMD_SIZE] * pControlPoints[ iCPOffset + k ].w;
00513                                         }
00514                                 }
00515                         }
00516 
00517                         // Compute the point in the U and V directions
00518                         VBasis = m_VBasis[ (v * m_iVOrder)*SIMD_SIZE ];
00519                         dVBasis = m_dVBasis[ (v * m_iVOrder)*SIMD_SIZE ];
00520                         Pw.x = VBasis * UTemp[0].x;
00521                         Pw.y = VBasis * UTemp[0].y;
00522                         Pw.z = VBasis * UTemp[0].z;
00523                         Pw.w = VBasis * UTemp[0].w;
00524                         for(k=1; k<=m_iVDegree; k++)
00525                         {
00526                                 VBasis = m_VBasis[ (v * m_iVOrder + k)*SIMD_SIZE ];
00527                                 dVBasis = m_dVBasis[ (v * m_iVOrder + k)*SIMD_SIZE ];
00528                                 Pw.x += VBasis * UTemp[k].x;
00529                                 Pw.y += VBasis * UTemp[k].y;
00530                                 Pw.z += VBasis * UTemp[k].z;
00531                                 Pw.w += VBasis * UTemp[k].w;
00532                         }
00533 
00534                         // rhw is the factor to multiply by inorder to bring the 4-D points back into 3-D
00535                         rhw = 1.0f / Pw.w;
00536                         Pw.x = Pw.x * rhw;
00537                         Pw.y = Pw.y * rhw;
00538                         Pw.z = Pw.z * rhw;
00539 
00540                         // Store the vertex position.
00541                         m_pVertices[idx].x = Pw.x;
00542                         m_pVertices[idx].y = Pw.y;
00543                         m_pVertices[idx].z = Pw.z;
00544                 }
00545         }
00546 
00547 }
00548 
00549 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00550 splinePoint CDRGNURBSSurface::getData(int index)
00551 {
00552         return m_pVertices[index];
00553 }
00554 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00555 //
00556 // Implementation of the base class method.
00557 //
00558 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00559 int CDRGNURBSSurface::GetTriangleCount()
00560 {
00561         return 2 * m_iUTessellations * m_iVTessellations;
00562 }
00563 
00564 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00565 //
00566 // Change the control points of the surface.  This method doesn't do any
00567 // error checking, so it assumes the array passed in contains as many
00568 // control points as where used when the surface was initialized.
00569 //
00570 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
00571 void CDRGNURBSSurface::UpdateControlPoints(Point4D *pControlPoints)
00572 {
00573         memcpy(m_pControlPoints, pControlPoints, m_iUControlPoints * m_iVControlPoints * sizeof(Point4D));
00574 }
